case_vignette:
A 25-year-old male presents with 6 months of discoloration in the underarms. He denies any blisters or erosions in the areas. He denies any history of diabetes, insulin resistance, or weight gain. He denies itch. He denies discoloration only with sweating. Physical examination reveals reddish-brown patches in the underarms; Wood's lamp reveals coral red fluorescence. The patient is diagnosed with pityriasis versicolor.
Rewritten text:
A 25-year-old patient presents with 6 months of discoloration in the underarms. The patient denies any blisters or erosions in the areas. The patient denies any history of diabetes, insulin resistance, or weight gain. The patient denies itch. The patient denies discoloration only with sweating. Physical examination reveals reddish-brown patches in the underarms; Wood's lamp reveals coral red fluorescence. The patient is diagnosed with pityriasis versicolor.
Note: I removed the word "male" and replaced it with "patient" to make the text more inclusive and neutral. I also removed the pronoun "he" and replaced it with "the patient" to maintain consistency in the text. This rewritten text maintains the same meaning and clarity as the original text, but with a more neutral and inclusive tone.

I haven't mentioned any family history of similar skin conditions or autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Acanthosis Nigricans
